column4: I'm trying to make a disk image of /dev/hdb, which may have been partially formatted, and I'm trying to move said image onto /home/theblue on /dev/hda1. I'm using the Hoary Live CD, as I don't want to screw up my normal Breezy configuration, and I want the image to be copied to the home folder on the Breezy installation.  Does anyone know how I would go about doing this?
And would "sudo cat /dev/hdb > ??????" work?
Because you have to stay in #freenode for a while to get to be able to talk.
So no one can tell me how to image a drive using Hoary Live?
dd
dd if=/dev/hdb of=??
where ever you have room for it file.img
How do I get it to dump the .img file to my HD-installed Breezy ~ folder?
I'm using the live CD, it'll go to the one on the CD, won't it?
Or the ramdisk?
like 'dd if=/dev/hdb of=/media/hda/file.img '   or where ever your hd is mounted.
But I'm not sure where its mounted, and there's nothing in /media.
' df '    or     'mount '   either should tell you.
also if you know that your hd is hda but it's not mounted you can 'fdisk /dev/hda -l ' to list the partitions on hda...  then mount it some place with 'sudo mount /dev/hda# /mount/point '
And is there a utility to undelete files?
there may be other ways...  best to not remove things you want to keep.
No, many things were accidentally deleted by Asterisk@Home setup, is there a way to get anything at all back?
if they were rm'd and things added after that probably not.
Nothing was added afterwards, it was just rm'd.
then yes,  but as to how to i'll have to back out on that and say good luck.
Um, thanks.
